title: REA Group backs 'Airtasker for property managers'
text:
Since launching last year, Managed has signed up 5000 tradespeople as well as more than 105 real estate agencies who are using the app to either partially or wholly manage their rent rolls.

Managed is free for real estate agencies to use. It is not available to landlords who self-manage their investment properties.

To date, more than $60 million of tradie jobs have flowed across the app, representing more than 51,000 individual transactions. Managed takes a small fee on each successful job.

"We're similar to Airtasker [an online marketplace that enables users to outsource everyday tasks] but we take a much smaller clip of the ticket," Mr Whitlock said.

He said REA Group's investment was sizeable, with the funds to be used to grow its team and introduce new bolt-on services.

"We won't have to do a capital raising for the forseeable future," he told The Australian Financial Review.

Andrew Rechtman, chief customer product officer at REA Group, said the investment reinforced its commitment to its property management customers.

"By working with new software providers, such as Managed App, we will increase operating efficiencies for property managers, helping streamline the number of systems required to complete their work,” he said.

Mr Bouris said the app’s integrated payment system is helping tradies get paid quickly and keeping tenants happier "with speedier attention to any issues".
description: Tenants use the managed platform to pay rent and lodge requests for maintenance and repairs. To date more than 5000 tradies have signed up to bid for work.
